column9: This drug has a host of undesired serious side affects and can cause other symptoms for which doctors will prescribe additional meds. Beware. It is also possible symptoms this drug are prescribed to treat are caused by other meds. Use minimally. You may be better off without.

column9: Before this medication, I was have severe episodes and since I have been on abilify I have not had any.  It saved my marriage.

column1: Bipolar I Disorder with Most Recent Episode Mixed
column2: mswilson,  Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Caregiver)
column9: My 55 year old father was recently taken off Respridol and put on Abilify. In two weeks time he has lost mobility. He complains of stiff muscles in his legs. He looks like hes ice skating when he's trying to walk, unable to pick up his feet. He's not sleeping and even though i have to hold him up to walk, he still has the urge to get up and walk around every 10-15 mins. It's scary and sad to see my father like this. His eyes that were once bright and twinkled now look dull, dead and aged. The slight change in his mood swings aren't worth all of the side effects!

column2: mel, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: My Doctor put me on Abilify to help kick in the Lexapro, after only 7 days i feel 100% better not quite where i want to be yet but a drastic improvement for me.Can't wait to see what the future holds!My advice to anyone just starting on antidepressants is dont give up the longsuffering is well worth it,Hang in there!!

column2: Gordon, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Ablify was added to my Zoloft approx. 2 months ago. It has been a god send as I have Major Depressive disorder re current. I know get up from bed and have more energy to interact with others. 10mg. of Ablify has done it. Please if you suffer from Major Depression unresolved from SSRI's ask your doctor about this med. I am not 100% but the mood is so much better I can not tell you.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I was much happier, and motivate to go out and do things. Only prob was I was TOO motivated, it was like I had restless BODY syndrome. I may be the only person who had this reaction, but I broke out in huge hives all over my body. We couldn't figure out what it was until I quit taking Abilify. *If it hadn't been for the hives, I'd still be on it. The restless feeling was definitely worth the good moods.

column2: prozacplease, 19-24 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: This is a better treatment for bipolar,schizophrenia is more of an incureable disease. The mood stablizing that this drug offers is useful when becomeing used to the symptoms associated with schizophrenia... It is not a cure all and there is no cure for something that is not caused by an chemical imbalance. However like I said it may ease the emotional symptoms, and cause weight gain etc.
